# Warmup Plots of the Data Set

```{r prepare-data, echo=TRUE, message=TRUE, warning=TRUE, dev='svg'}
# load libraries, the data, and prepare it
if (Sys.getenv("RSTUDIO") == "1") { setwd("/Users/smarr/Projects/PostDoc/FASTXX/are-we-fast-yet/report") }

source("scripts/libraries.R", chdir=TRUE)

load_and_install_if_necessary("yaml")

conf <- read_yaml("../../awfy-runs/codespeed.conf")

# REM: display_name is not mandatory in ReBench configs, and new/not standard, should have a fallback
vm_names <- sapply(conf$virtual_machines, function (vm) return(vm$display_name))


data <- load_data_file("data/all/121-450e6527/benchmark.data")
data <- subset(data, select = c(Value, Unit, Benchmark, VM, Cores, Iteration))
data <- prepare_vm_names(data,vm_names)

summary(data)

warmup_plot <- function (data_b, b, t = "") {
  ## First take the medians over the values for each VM separated
  medians <- ddply(data_b, ~ VM, summarise,
             median = median(Value))
  # use the highest one with a little margin as an upper bound
  upperBound <- 2 * max(medians$median)
  data_b <- ddply(data_b, ~ Benchmark, here(transform),
                  ValCut = pmin(Value, upperBound))

  plot <- ggplot(data_b, aes(x=Iteration, y=ValCut))
  plot <- plot + geom_line(aes(colour = VM))
  plot <- plot + ggtitle(paste0(b, t))
  plot <- plot + scale_x_continuous(breaks = seq(0, max(data_b$Iteration), 100))
  plot <- plot + geom_vline(xintercept = c(100, 200, 300), linetype = "longdash", colour = "#cccccc")
  plot <- plot + theme_simple()
  print(plot)
}
```

# Plots

```{r warmup-plots, echo=FALSE, dev='png', fig.keep='all', fig.width=10, fig.height=6}
b <- "Mandelbrot"

for (b in levels(data$Benchmark)) {
  data_b <- droplevels(subset(data, Benchmark == b))
  warmup_plot(data_b, b)
}
```

# Plots separate by Benchmark type

```{r warmup-plots-jruby, echo=FALSE, dev='png', fig.keep='all', fig.width=10, fig.height=6}
b <- "Mandelbrot"

for (b in levels(data$Benchmark)) {
  data_b <- droplevels(subset(data, Benchmark == b))
  
  for (t in levels(data_b$Cores)) {
    data_t <- droplevels(subset(data_b, Cores == t))
    warmup_plot(data_t, b, paste0(" ", t))
  }
}
```
